member.summary: computes another complex cornerness criteria at each pixel

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.CornerSubPix(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenCvSharp.Point2f},OpenCvSharp.Size,OpenCvSharp.Size,OpenCvSharp.TermCriteria)
member.summary: adjusts the corner locations with sub-pixel accuracy to maximize the certain cornerness criteria
member.param: Initial coordinates of the input corners and refined coordinates provided for output.
Half of the side length of the search window.

Half of the size of the dead region in the middle of the search zone over which the summation in the formula below is not done. It is used sometimes to avoid possible singularities of the autocorrelation matrix. The value of (-1,-1) indicates that there is no such a size.

Criteria for termination of the iterative process of corner refinement. That is, the process of corner position refinement stops either after criteria.maxCount iterations or when the corner position moves by less than criteria.epsilon on some iteration.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.GoodFeaturesToTrack(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the strong enough corners where the cornerMinEigenVal() or cornerHarris() report the local maxima. Input matrix must be 8-bit or floating-point 32-bit, single-channel image.
member.param: Maximum number of corners to return. If there are more corners than are found, the strongest of them is returned.

Parameter characterizing the minimal accepted quality of image corners. The parameter value is multiplied by the best corner quality measure, which is the minimal eigenvalue or the Harris function response (see cornerHarris() ). The corners with the quality measure less than the product are rejected. For example, if the best corner has the quality measure = 1500, and the qualityLevel=0.01, then all the corners with the quality measure less than 15 are rejected.
Minimum possible Euclidean distance between the returned corners.
Optional region of interest. If the image is not empty (it needs to have the type CV_8UC1 and the same size as image ), it specifies the region in which the corners are detected.
Size of an average block for computing a derivative covariation matrix over each pixel neighborhood.
Parameter indicating whether to use a Harris detector
Free parameter of the Harris detector.
member.returns: Output vector of detected corners.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.HoughLines(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds lines in a binary image using standard Hough transform. The input matrix must be 8-bit, single-channel, binary source image. This image may be modified by the function.
member.param: Distance resolution of the accumulator in pixels
Angle resolution of the accumulator in radians
The accumulator threshold parameter. Only those lines are returned that get enough votes ( > threshold )
For the multi-scale Hough transform it is the divisor for the distance resolution rho. [By default this is 0]
For the multi-scale Hough transform it is the divisor for the distance resolution theta. [By default this is 0]
member.returns: The output vector of lines. Each line is represented by a two-element vector (rho, theta) . rho is the distance from the coordinate origin (0,0) (top-left corner of the image) and theta is the line rotation angle in radians

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.HoughLinesP(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds lines segments in a binary image using probabilistic Hough transform.
member.param: Distance resolution of the accumulator in pixels
Angle resolution of the accumulator in radians
The accumulator threshold parameter. Only those lines are returned that get enough votes ( > threshold )
The minimum line length. Line segments shorter than that will be rejected. [By default this is 0]
The maximum allowed gap between points on the same line to link them. [By default this is 0]
member.returns: The output lines. Each line is represented by a 4-element vector (x1, y1, x2, y2)

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.HoughCircles(OpenCvSharp.HoughMethods,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)

The inverse ratio of the accumulator resolution to the image resolution.
Minimum distance between the centers of the detected circles.
The first method-specific parameter. [By default this is 100]
The second method-specific parameter. [By default this is 100]
Minimum circle radius. [By default this is 0]
Maximum circle radius. [By default this is 0]
member.returns: The output vector found circles. Each vector is encoded as 3-element floating-point vector (x, y, radius)

interpolation method

size of the output image.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.UndistortPoints(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray)
member.summary: Computes the ideal point coordinates from the observed point coordinates. Input matrix is an observed point coordinates, 1xN or Nx1 2-channel (CV_32FC2 or CV_64FC2).
member.param: Camera matrix
Input vector of distortion coefficients (k_1, k_2, p_1, p_2[, k_3[, k_4, k_5, k_6]]) of 4, 5, or 8 elements. If the vector is null, the zero distortion coefficients are assumed.
Rectification transformation in the object space (3x3 matrix). R1 or R2 computed by stereoRectify() can be passed here. If the matrix is empty, the identity transformation is used.
New camera matrix (3x3) or new projection matrix (3x4). P1 or P2 computed by stereoRectify() can be passed here. If the matrix is empty, the identity new camera matrix is used.
member.returns: Output ideal point coordinates after undistortion and reverse perspective transformation. If matrix P is identity or omitted, dst will contain normalized point coordinates.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.GrabCut(OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray,OpenCvSharp.Rect,OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.GrabCutModes)
member.summary: Segments the image using GrabCut algorithm. The input is 8-bit 3-channel image.
member.param: Input/output 8-bit single-channel mask. The mask is initialized by the function when mode is set to GC_INIT_WITH_RECT. Its elements may have Cv2.GC_BGD / Cv2.GC_FGD / Cv2.GC_PR_BGD / Cv2.GC_PR_FGD
ROI containing a segmented object. The pixels outside of the ROI are marked as "obvious background". The parameter is only used when mode==GC_INIT_WITH_RECT.
Temporary array for the background model. Do not modify it while you are processing the same image.
Temporary arrays for the foreground model. Do not modify it while you are processing the same image.
Number of iterations the algorithm should make before returning the result. Note that the result can be refined with further calls with mode==GC_INIT_WITH_MASK or mode==GC_EVAL .
Operation mode that could be one of GrabCutFlag value.

member.summary: Fills a connected component with the given color. Input/output 1- or 3-channel, 8-bit, or floating-point image. It is modified by the function unless the FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY flag is set in the second variant of the function. See the details below.
member.param: Starting point.
New value of the repainted domain pixels.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.FloodFill(OpenCvSharp.Point,OpenCvSharp.Scalar,OpenCvSharp.Rect@,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Scalar},System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Scalar},OpenCvSharp.FloodFillFlags)
member.summary: Fills a connected component with the given color. Input/output 1- or 3-channel, 8-bit, or floating-point image. It is modified by the function unless the FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY flag is set in the second variant of the function. See the details below.
member.param: Starting point.
New value of the repainted domain pixels.
Optional output parameter set by the function to the minimum bounding rectangle of the repainted domain.
Maximal lower brightness/color difference between the currently observed pixel and one of its neighbors belonging to the component, or a seed pixel being added to the component.
Maximal upper brightness/color difference between the currently observed pixel and one of its neighbors belonging to the component, or a seed pixel being added to the component.
Operation flags. Lower bits contain a connectivity value, 4 (default) or 8, used within the function. Connectivity determines which neighbors of a pixel are considered.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.FloodFill(OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray,OpenCvSharp.Point,OpenCvSharp.Scalar)
member.summary: Fills a connected component with the given color. Input/output 1- or 3-channel, 8-bit, or floating-point image. It is modified by the function unless the FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY flag is set in the second variant of the function. See the details below.
member.param: (For the second function only) Operation mask that should be a single-channel 8-bit image, 2 pixels wider and 2 pixels taller. The function uses and updates the mask, so you take responsibility of initializing the mask content. Flood-filling cannot go across non-zero pixels in the mask. For example, an edge detector output can be used as a mask to stop filling at edges. It is possible to use the same mask in multiple calls to the function to make sure the filled area does not overlap.
Starting point.
New value of the repainted domain pixels.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.FindContours(OpenCvSharp.Point[][]@,OpenCvSharp.HierarchyIndex[]@,OpenCvSharp.RetrievalModes,OpenCvSharp.ContourApproximationModes,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Point})
member.summary: Finds contours in a binary image. The source is an 8-bit single-channel image. Non-zero pixels are treated as 1’s. Zero pixels remain 0’s, so the image is treated as binary. The function modifies this image while extracting the contours.
member.param: Detected contours. Each contour is stored as a vector of points.

Optional output vector, containing information about the image topology. It has as many elements as the number of contours. For each i-th contour contours[i], the members of the elements hierarchy[i] are set to 0-based indices in contours of the next and previous contours at the same hierarchical level, the first child contour and the parent contour, respectively. If for the contour i there are no next, previous, parent, or nested contours, the corresponding elements of hierarchy[i] will be negative.
Contour retrieval mode
Contour approximation method
Optional offset by which every contour point is shifted. This is useful if the contours are extracted from the image ROI and then they should be analyzed in the whole image context.

member.summary: Draws contours in the image
member.param: All the input contours. Each contour is stored as a point vector.
Parameter indicating a contour to draw. If it is negative, all the contours are drawn.
Color of the contours.
Thickness of lines the contours are drawn with. If it is negative (for example, thickness=CV_FILLED ), the contour interiors are drawn.
Line connectivity.
Optional information about hierarchy. It is only needed if you want to draw only some of the contours

Maximal level for drawn contours. If it is 0, only the specified contour is drawn. If it is 1, the function draws the contour(s) and all the nested contours. If it is 2, the function draws the contours, all the nested contours, all the nested-to-nested contours, and so on. This parameter is only taken into account when there is hierarchy available.
Optional contour shift parameter. Shift all the drawn contours by the specified offset = (dx, dy)

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.ConvexHull(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes convex hull for a set of 2D points.
member.param: The input 2D point set, represented by CV_32SC2 or CV_32FC2 matrix

If true, the output convex hull will be oriented clockwise, otherwise it will be oriented counter-clockwise. Here, the usual screen coordinate system is assumed - the origin is at the top-left corner, x axis is oriented to the right, and y axis is oriented downwards.
member.returns: The output convex hull. It is either a vector of points that form the hull (must have the same type as the input points), or a vector of 0-based point indices of the hull points in the original array (since the set of convex hull points is a subset of the original point set).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.ConvexHullPoints(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes convex hull for a set of 2D points.
member.param: The input 2D point set, represented by CV_32SC2 or CV_32FC2 matrix

If true, the output convex hull will be oriented clockwise, otherwise it will be oriented counter-clockwise. Here, the usual screen coordinate system is assumed - the origin is at the top-left corner, x axis is oriented to the right, and y axis is oriented downwards.
member.returns: The output convex hull. It is a vector of points that form the hull (must have the same type as the input points).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.ConvexityDefects(OpenCvSharp.InputArray)
member.summary: Computes the contour convexity defects
member.param: Convex hull obtained using convexHull() that should contain indices of the contour points that make the hull.
member.returns: The output vector of convexity defects. Each convexity defect is represented as 4-element integer vector (a.k.a. cv::Vec4i): (start_index, end_index, farthest_pt_index, fixpt_depth), where indices are 0-based indices in the original contour of the convexity defect beginning, end and the farthest point, and fixpt_depth is fixed-point approximation (with 8 fractional bits) of the distance between the farthest contour point and the hull. That is, to get the floating-point value of the depth will be fixpt_depth/256.0.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.ConvexityDefectsAsVec(OpenCvSharp.InputArray)
member.summary: Computes the contour convexity defects
member.param: Convex hull obtained using convexHull() that should contain indices of the contour points that make the hull.
member.returns: The output vector of convexity defects. Each convexity defect is represented as 4-element integer vector (a.k.a. cv::Vec4i): (start_index, end_index, farthest_pt_index, fixpt_depth), where indices are 0-based indices in the original contour of the convexity defect beginning, end and the farthest point, and fixpt_depth is fixed-point approximation (with 8 fractional bits) of the distance between the farthest contour point and the hull. That is, to get the floating-point value of the depth will be fixpt_depth/256.0.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Range[])
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Rect)
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Region of interest.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.MatType,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or MatType. CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel matrices.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},OpenCvSharp.MatType,System.IntPtr,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int64})
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Array of integers specifying an n-dimensional array shape.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or MatType. CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel matrices.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.
Array of ndims-1 steps in case of a multi-dimensional array (the last step is always set to the element size). If not specified, the matrix is assumed to be continuous.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources
member.param: If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.MatType)
member.summary: constructs 2D matrix of the specified size and type
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or MatType. CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel matrices.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Size,OpenCvSharp.MatType)
member.summary: constructs 2D matrix of the specified size and type
member.param: 2D array size: Size(cols, rows) . In the Size() constructor, the number of rows and the number of columns go in the reverse order.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or MatType.CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel matrices.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.MatType,OpenCvSharp.Scalar)
member.summary: constucts 2D matrix and fills it with the specified Scalar value.
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or MatType. CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel matrices.
An optional value to initialize each matrix element with. To set all the matrix elements to the particular value after the construction, use SetTo(Scalar s) method .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Size,OpenCvSharp.MatType,OpenCvSharp.Scalar)
member.summary: constucts 2D matrix and fills it with the specified Scalar value.
member.param: 2D array size: Size(cols, rows) . In the Size() constructor, the number of rows and the number of columns go in the reverse order.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel (up to CV_CN_MAX channels) matrices.
An optional value to initialize each matrix element with. To set all the matrix elements to the particular value after the construction, use SetTo(Scalar s) method .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Mat{`0,`1},OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Mat{`0,`1},OpenCvSharp.Range[])
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.Mat{`0,`1},OpenCvSharp.Rect)
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Region of interest.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Mat`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.MatType,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.
Array type. Use MatType.CV_8UC1, ..., CV_64FC4 to create 1-4 channel matrices, or MatType. CV_8UC(n), ..., CV_64FC(n) to create multi-channel matrices.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfInt4.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfInt4,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfInt4.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfInt4,OpenCvSharp.Range[])
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix

So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.FlannBasedMatcher
member.summary: Brute-force descriptor matcher. For each descriptor in the first set, this matcher finds the closest descriptor in the second set by trying each one.

member.summary: Create descriptor matcher by type name.

member.summary: Creates instance from cv::Ptr<T> . ptr is disposed when the wrapper disposes.

member.summary: Creates instance from raw pointer T*

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources
member.param: If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenCvSharp.Mat})
member.summary: Add descriptors to train descriptor collection.
member.param: Descriptors to add. Each descriptors[i] is a descriptors set from one image.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.GetTrainDescriptors
member.summary: Get train descriptors collection.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Clear
member.summary: Clear train descriptors collection.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Empty
member.summary: Return true if there are not train descriptors in collection.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.IsMaskSupported
member.summary: Return true if the matcher supports mask in match methods.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Train
member.summary: Train matcher (e.g. train flann index). In all methods to match the method train() is run every time before matching. Some descriptor matchers (e.g. BruteForceMatcher) have empty implementation of this method, other matchers really train their inner structures (e.g. FlannBasedMatcher trains flann::Index). So nonempty implementation of train() should check the class object state and do traing/retraining only if the state requires that (e.g. FlannBasedMatcher trains flann::Index if it has not trained yet or if new descriptors have been added to the train collection).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Match(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat)
member.summary: Find one best match for each query descriptor (if mask is empty).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.KnnMatch(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find k best matches for each query descriptor (in increasing order of distances). compactResult is used when mask is not empty. If compactResult is false matches vector will have the same size as queryDescriptors rows. If compactResult is true matches vector will not contain matches for fully masked out query descriptors.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.RadiusMatch(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Single,OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find best matches for each query descriptor which have distance less than maxDistance (in increasing order of distances).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.Match(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat[])
member.summary: Find one best match for each query descriptor (if mask is empty).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.KnnMatch(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.Mat[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find k best matches for each query descriptor (in increasing order of distances). compactResult is used when mask is not empty. If compactResult is false matches vector will have the same size as queryDescriptors rows. If compactResult is true matches vector will not contain matches for fully masked out query descriptors.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.DescriptorMatcher.RadiusMatch(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Single,OpenCvSharp.Mat[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find best matches for each query descriptor which have distance less than maxDistance (in increasing order of distances).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetRoots
member.summary: Returns indices of root nodes

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetNodes
member.summary: Returns all the nodes. all the node indices are indices in the returned vector

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetSplits
member.summary: Returns all the splits. all the split indices are indices in the returned vector

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetSubsets
member.summary: Returns all the bitsets for categorical splits. Split::subsetOfs is an offset in the returned vector

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.MaxCategories
member.summary: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K < =maxCategories clusters to find a suboptimal split.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.MaxDepth
member.summary: The maximum possible depth of the tree.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.MinSampleCount
member.summary: If the number of samples in a node is less than this parameter then the node will not be split. Default value is 10.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.CVFolds
member.summary: If CVFolds \> 1 then algorithms prunes the built decision tree using K-fold cross-validation procedure where K is equal to CVFolds. Default value is 10.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.UseSurrogates
member.summary: If true then surrogate splits will be built. These splits allow to work with missing data and compute variable importance correctly. Default value is false.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Use1SERule
member.summary: If true then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate. Default value is true.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.TruncatePrunedTree
member.summary: If true then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree. Otherwise they are retained and it is possible to get results from the original unpruned (or pruned less aggressively) tree. Default value is true.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.RegressionAccuracy
member.summary: Termination criteria for regression trees. If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and values of train samples in this node are less than this parameter then the node will not be split further. Default value is 0.01f.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Priors
member.summary: The array of a priori class probabilities, sorted by the class label value.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node
member.summary: The class represents a decision tree node.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.Value
member.summary: Value at the node: a class label in case of classification or estimated function value in case of regression.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.ClassIdx
member.summary: Class index normalized to 0..class_count-1 range and assigned to the node. It is used internally in classification trees and tree ensembles.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.Parent
member.summary: Index of the parent node

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.Left
member.summary: Index of the left child node

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.Right
member.summary: Index of right child node

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.DefaultDir
member.summary: Default direction where to go (-1: left or +1: right). It helps in the case of missing values.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Node.Split
member.summary: Index of the first split

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split
member.summary: The class represents split in a decision tree.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split.VarIdx
member.summary: Index of variable on which the split is created.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split.Inversed
member.summary: If not 0, then the inverse split rule is used (i.e. left and right branches are exchanged in the rule expressions below).

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split.Quality
member.summary: The split quality, a positive number. It is used to choose the best split.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split.Next
member.summary: Index of the next split in the list of splits for the node

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split.C
member.summary: The threshold value in case of split on an ordered variable.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Split.SubsetOfs
member.summary: Offset of the bitset used by the split on a categorical variable.

member.summary: The number of weak classifiers. Default value is 100.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.WeightTrimRate
member.summary: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight \f$\leq 1 - weight_trim_rate do not participate in the *next* iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality. Default value is 0.95.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types
member.summary: Boosting type. Gentle AdaBoost and Real AdaBoost are often the preferable choices.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Discrete
member.summary: Discrete AdaBoost.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Real
member.summary: Real AdaBoost. It is a technique that utilizes confidence-rated predictions and works well with categorical data.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Logit
member.summary: LogitBoost. It can produce good regression fits.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Gentle
member.summary: Gentle AdaBoost. It puts less weight on outlier data points and for that reason is often good with regression data.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.NormalBayesClassifier.PredictProb(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Int32)
member.summary: Predicts the response for sample(s).
member.remarks: The method estimates the most probable classes for input vectors. Input vectors (one or more) are stored as rows of the matrix inputs. In case of multiple input vectors, there should be one output vector outputs. The predicted class for a single input vector is returned by the method. The vector outputProbs contains the output probabilities corresponding to each element of result.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.GetWeights
member.summary: Returns weights of the mixtures. Returns vector with the number of elements equal to the number of mixtures.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.GetMeans
member.summary: Returns the cluster centers (means of the Gaussian mixture). Returns matrix with the number of rows equal to the number of mixtures and number of columns equal to the space dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.GetCovs
member.summary: Returns covariation matrices. Returns vector of covariation matrices. Number of matrices is the number of gaussian mixtures, each matrix is a square floating-point matrix NxN, where N is the space dimensionality.

member.summary: Predicts the response for sample

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.EM.ClustersNumber
member.summary: The number of mixture components in the Gaussian mixture model. Default value of the parameter is EM::DEFAULT_NCLUSTERS=5. Some of EM implementation could determine the optimal number of mixtures within a specified value range, but that is not the case in ML yet.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.EM.CovarianceMatrixType
member.summary: Constraint on covariance matrices which defines type of matrices.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.EM.TermCriteria
member.summary: The termination criteria of the %EM algorithm. The EM algorithm can be terminated by the number of iterations termCrit.maxCount (number of M-steps) or when relative change of likelihood logarithm is less than termCrit.epsilon. Default maximum number of iterations is EM::DEFAULT_MAX_ITERS=100.

member.summary: Type of covariation matrices

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types.CovMatSpherical
member.summary: A scaled identity matrix \f$\mu_k * I\f$. There is the only parameter \f$\mu_k\f$ to be estimated for each matrix. The option may be used in special cases, when the constraint is relevant, or as a first step in the optimization (for example in case when the data is preprocessed with PCA). The results of such preliminary estimation may be passed again to the optimization procedure, this time with covMatType=EM::COV_MAT_DIAGONAL.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types.CovMatDiagonal
member.summary: A diagonal matrix with positive diagonal elements. The number of free parameters is d for each matrix. This is most commonly used option yielding good estimation results.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types.CovMatGeneric
member.summary: A symmetric positively defined matrix. The number of free parameters in each matrix is about \f$d^2/2\f$. It is not recommended to use this option, unless there is pretty accurate initial estimation of the parameters and/or a huge number of training samples.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep
member.summary: The initial step the algorithm starts from

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep.E
member.summary: The algorithm starts with E-step. At least, the initial values of mean vectors, CvEMParams.Means must be passed. Optionally, the user may also provide initial values for weights (CvEMParams.Weights) and/or covariation matrices (CvEMParams.Covs). [CvEM::START_E_STEP]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep.M
member.summary: The algorithm starts with M-step. The initial probabilities p_i,k must be provided. [CvEM::START_M_STEP]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep.Auto
member.summary: No values are required from the user, k-means algorithm is used to estimate initial mixtures parameters. [CvEM::START_AUTO_STEP]

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.KNearest.FindNearest(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Finds the neighbors and predicts responses for input vectors.
member.param: Input samples stored by rows. It is a single-precision floating-point matrix of `[number_of_samples] * k` size.
Number of used nearest neighbors. Should be greater than 1.
Vector with results of prediction (regression or classification) for each input sample. It is a single-precision floating-point vector with `[number_of_samples]` elements.
neighborResponses Optional output values for corresponding neighbors. It is a single-precision floating-point matrix of `[number_of_samples] * k` size.
Optional output distances from the input vectors to the corresponding neighbors. It is a single-precision floating-point matrix of `[number_of_samples] * k` size.

If false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.SetCustomKernel(OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Kernel)
member.summary: Initialize with custom kernel.
Trains an %SVM with optimal parameters.
member.param: the training data that can be constructed using TrainData::create or TrainData::loadFromCSV.
Cross-validation parameter. The training set is divided into kFold subsets. One subset is used to test the model, the others form the train set. So, the %SVM algorithm is executed kFold times.
grid for C
grid for gamma
grid for p
grid for nu
grid for coeff
grid for degree

If true and the problem is 2-class classification then the method creates more balanced cross-validation subsets that is proportions between classes in subsets are close to such proportion in the whole train dataset.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.GetSupportVectors
member.summary: Retrieves all the support vectors

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.GetDecisionFunction(System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Retrieves the decision function
member.param: i the index of the decision function. If the problem solved is regression, 1-class or 2-class classification, then there will be just one decision function and the index should always be 0. Otherwise, in the case of N-class classification, there will be N(N-1)/2 decision functions.
alpha the optional output vector for weights, corresponding to different support vectors. In the case of linear %SVM all the alpha's will be 1's.

the optional output vector of indices of support vectors within the matrix of support vectors (which can be retrieved by SVM::getSupportVectors). In the case of linear %SVM each decision function consists of a single "compressed" support vector.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.GetDefaultGrid(OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.ParamTypes)
member.summary: Generates a grid for SVM parameters.
member.param: SVM parameters IDs that must be one of the SVM::ParamTypes. The grid is generated for the parameter with this ID.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Type
member.summary: Type of a %SVM formulation. Default value is SVM::C_SVC.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Gamma
member.summary: Parameter gamma of a kernel function. For SVM::POLY, SVM::RBF, SVM::SIGMOID or SVM::CHI2. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Coef0
member.summary: Parameter coef0 of a kernel function. For SVM::POLY or SVM::SIGMOID. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Degree
member.summary: Parameter degree of a kernel function. For SVM::POLY. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.C
member.summary: Parameter C of a %SVM optimization problem. For SVM::C_SVC, SVM::EPS_SVR or SVM::NU_SVR. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Nu
member.summary: Parameter nu of a %SVM optimization problem. For SVM::NU_SVC, SVM::ONE_CLASS or SVM::NU_SVR. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.P
member.summary: Parameter epsilon of a %SVM optimization problem. For SVM::EPS_SVR. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.ClassWeights
member.summary: Optional weights in the SVM::C_SVC problem, assigned to particular classes.
member.remarks: They are multiplied by _C_ so the parameter _C_ of class _i_ becomes `classWeights(i) * C`. Thus these weights affect the misclassification penalty for different classes. The larger weight, the larger penalty on misclassification of data from the corresponding class. Default value is empty Mat.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.TermCriteria
member.summary: Termination criteria of the iterative SVM training procedure which solves a partial case of constrained quadratic optimization problem.
member.remarks: You can specify tolerance and/or the maximum number of iterations. Default value is `TermCriteria( TermCriteria::MAX_ITER + TermCriteria::EPS, 1000, FLT_EPSILON )`;

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelType
member.summary: Type of a %SVM kernel. See SVM::KernelTypes. Default value is SVM::RBF.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types
member.summary: SVM type

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.CSvc
member.summary: C-Support Vector Classification. n-class classification (n \f$\geq\f$ 2), allows imperfect separation of classes with penalty multiplier C for outliers.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.NuSvc
member.summary: nu-Support Vector Classification. n-class classification with possible imperfect separation. Parameter \f$\nu\f$ (in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision boundary) is used instead of C.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.OneClass
member.summary: Distribution Estimation (One-class %SVM). All the training data are from the same class, %SVM builds a boundary that separates the class from the rest of the feature space.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.EpsSvr
member.summary: epsilon-Support Vector Regression. The distance between feature vectors from the training set and the fitting hyper-plane must be less than p. For outliers the penalty multiplier C is used.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.NuSvr
member.summary: nu-Support Vector Regression. \f$\nu\f$ is used instead of p. See @cite LibSVM for details.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes
member.summary: SVM kernel type

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Custom
member.summary: Returned by SVM::getKernelType in case when custom kernel has been set

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Linear
member.summary: Linear kernel. No mapping is done, linear discrimination (or regression) is done in the original feature space. It is the fastest option. \f$K(x_i, x_j) = x_i^T x_j\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Poly
member.summary: Polynomial kernel: \f$K(x_i, x_j) = (\gamma x_i^T x_j + coef0)^{degree}, \gamma > 0\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Rbf
member.summary: Radial basis function (RBF), a good choice in most cases. \f$K(x_i, x_j) = e^{-\gamma ||x_i - x_j||^2}, \gamma > 0\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Sigmoid
member.summary: Sigmoid kernel: \f$K(x_i, x_j) = \tanh(\gamma x_i^T x_j + coef0)\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Chi2
member.summary: Exponential Chi2 kernel, similar to the RBF kernel: \f$K(x_i, x_j) = e^{-\gamma \chi^2(x_i,x_j)}, \chi^2(x_i,x_j) = (x_i-x_j)^2/(x_i+x_j), \gamma > 0\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Inter
member.summary: Histogram intersection kernel. A fast kernel. \f$K(x_i, x_j) = min(x_i,x_j)\f$.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.ParamTypes
member.summary: SVM params type

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.OpticalFlowFlags
member.summary: cv::calcOpticalFlowPyrLK flags

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.SolvePnPFlags
member.summary: Method for solving a PnP problem:

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.SolvePnPFlags.Iterative
member.summary: Iterative method is based on Levenberg-Marquardt optimization. In this case the function finds such a pose that minimizes reprojection error, that is the sum of squared distances between the observed projections imagePoints and the projected (using projectPoints() ) objectPoints .

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.SolvePnPFlags.EPNP
member.summary: Method has been introduced by F.Moreno-Noguer, V.Lepetit and P.Fua in the paper “EPnP: Efficient Perspective-n-Point Camera Pose Estimation”.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.SolvePnPFlags.P3P
member.summary: Method is based on the paper of X.S. Gao, X.-R. Hou, J. Tang, H.-F. Chang“Complete Solution Classification for the Perspective-Three-Point Problem”. In this case the function requires exactly four object and image points.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.SolvePnPFlags.DLS
member.summary: Joel A. Hesch and Stergios I. Roumeliotis. "A Direct Least-Squares (DLS) Method for PnP"

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.SolvePnPFlags.UPNP
member.summary: A.Penate-Sanchez, J.Andrade-Cetto, F.Moreno-Noguer. "Exhaustive Linearization for Robust Camera Pose and Focal Length Estimation"

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.DrawMatchesFlags.Default
member.summary: Output image matrix will be created (Mat::create), i.e. existing memory of output image may be reused. Two source image, matches and single keypoints will be drawn. For each keypoint only the center point will be drawn (without the circle around keypoint with keypoint size and orientation).

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.DrawMatchesFlags.DrawOverOutImg
member.summary: Output image matrix will not be created (Mat::create). Matches will be drawn on existing content of output image.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.DrawMatchesFlags.NotDrawSinglePoints
member.summary: Single keypoints will not be drawn.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.DrawMatchesFlags.DrawRichKeypoints
member.summary: For each keypoint the circle around keypoint with keypoint size and orientation will be drawn.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP
member.summary: Artificial Neural Networks - Multi-Layer Perceptrons.

member.summary: Track whether Dispose has been called

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates instance by raw pointer cv::ml::ANN_MLP*

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.Create
member.summary: Creates the empty model.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TermCriteria
member.summary: Termination criteria of the training algorithm.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.BackpropWeightScale
member.summary: Strength of the weight gradient term. The recommended value is about 0.1. Default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.BackpropMomentumScale
member.summary: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough. Default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDW0
member.summary: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_{ij}. Default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWPlus
member.summary: Increase factor eta^+. It must be >1. Default value is 1.2.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWMinus
member.summary: Decrease factor eta^-. It must be \>1. Default value is 0.5.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWMin
member.summary: Update-values lower limit Delta_{min}. It must be positive. Default value is FLT_EPSILON.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWMax
member.summary: Update-values upper limit Delta_{max}. It must be >1. Default value is 50.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions
member.summary: possible activation functions

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions.Identity
member.summary: Identity function: $f(x)=x

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions.SigmoidSym
member.summary: Symmetrical sigmoid: f(x)=\beta*(1-e^{-\alpha x})/(1+e^{-\alpha x}

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions.Gaussian
member.summary: Gaussian function: f(x)=\beta e^{-\alpha x*x}

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags
member.summary: Train options

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags.UpdateWeights
member.summary: Update the network weights, rather than compute them from scratch. In the latter case the weights are initialized using the Nguyen-Widrow algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags.NoInputScale
member.summary: Do not normalize the input vectors. If this flag is not set, the training algorithm normalizes each input feature independently, shifting its mean value to 0 and making the standard deviation equal to 1. If the network is assumed to be updated frequently, the new training data could be much different from original one. In this case, you should take care of proper normalization.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags.NoOutputScale
member.summary: Do not normalize the output vectors. If the flag is not set, the training algorithm normalizes each output feature independently, by transforming it to the certain range depending on the used activation function.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainingMethods
member.summary: Available training methods

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainingMethods.BackProp
member.summary: The back-propagation algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainingMethods.RProp
member.summary: The RPROP algorithm. See @cite RPROP93 for details.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.CascadeClassifier.DetectMultiScale(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Double,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size},System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size})
member.summary: Detects objects of different sizes in the input image. The detected objects are returned as a list of rectangles.
member.param: Matrix of the type CV_8U containing an image where objects are detected.
Parameter specifying how much the image size is reduced at each image scale.
Parameter specifying how many neighbors each candidate rectangle should have to retain it.
Parameter with the same meaning for an old cascade as in the function cvHaarDetectObjects. It is not used for a new cascade.
Minimum possible object size. Objects smaller than that are ignored.
Maximum possible object size. Objects larger than that are ignored.
member.returns: Vector of rectangles where each rectangle contains the detected object.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.CascadeClassifier.DetectMultiScale(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Int32[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size},System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Detects objects of different sizes in the input image. The detected objects are returned as a list of rectangles.
member.param: Matrix of the type CV_8U containing an image where objects are detected.
Parameter specifying how much the image size is reduced at each image scale.
Parameter specifying how many neighbors each candidate rectangle should have to retain it.
Parameter with the same meaning for an old cascade as in the function cvHaarDetectObjects. It is not used for a new cascade.
Minimum possible object size. Objects smaller than that are ignored.
Maximum possible object size. Objects larger than that are ignored.
member.returns: Vector of rectangles where each rectangle contains the detected object.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter
member.summary: Kalman filter. The class implements standard Kalman filter \url{http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalman_filter}. However, you can modify KalmanFilter::transitionMatrix, KalmanFilter::controlMatrix and KalmanFilter::measurementMatrix to get the extended Kalman filter functionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.#ctor
member.summary: the default constructor

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: the full constructor taking the dimensionality of the state, of the measurement and of the control vector

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.Init(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: re-initializes Kalman filter. The previous content is destroyed.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.Predict(OpenCvSharp.Mat)
member.summary: computes predicted state

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.Correct(OpenCvSharp.Mat)
member.summary: updates the predicted state from the measurement

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.StatePre
member.summary: predicted state (x'(k)): x(k)=A*x(k-1)+B*u(k)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.StatePost
member.summary: corrected state (x(k)): x(k)=x'(k)+K(k)*(z(k)-H*x'(k))

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.TransitionMatrix
member.summary: state transition matrix (A)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ControlMatrix
member.summary: control matrix (B) (not used if there is no control)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.MeasurementMatrix
member.summary: measurement matrix (H)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ProcessNoiseCov
member.summary: process noise covariance matrix (Q)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.MeasurementNoiseCov
member.summary: measurement noise covariance matrix (R)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ErrorCovPre
member.summary: priori error estimate covariance matrix (P'(k)): P'(k)=A*P(k-1)*At + Q)*/

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.Gain
member.summary: Kalman gain matrix (K(k)): K(k)=P'(k)*Ht*inv(H*P'(k)*Ht+R)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ErrorCovPost
member.summary: posteriori error estimate covariance matrix (P(k)): P(k)=(I-K(k)*H)*P'(k)

member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfDouble.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfDMatch.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfDMatch,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfDMatch.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfDMatch,OpenCvSharp.Range[])
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfDouble3.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint2f.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint2f,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort,OpenCvSharp.Range[])
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort,OpenCvSharp.Rect)

Region of interest.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfShort.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfFloat.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.
Array of ndims-1 steps in case of a multi-dimensional array (the last step is always set to the element size). If not specified, the matrix is assumed to be continuous.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3i.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3i,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3i.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3i,OpenCvSharp.Range[])

Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3i.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3d.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3d,OpenCvSharp.Range,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Range})
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat::clone() .
Range of the m rows to take. As usual, the range start is inclusive and the range end is exclusive. Use Range.All to take all the rows.
Range of the m columns to take. Use Range.All to take all the columns.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3d.#ctor(OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3d,OpenCvSharp.Range[])
member.summary: creates a matrix header for a part of the bigger matrix
member.param: Array that (as a whole or partly) is assigned to the constructed matrix. No data is copied by these constructors. Instead, the header pointing to m data or its sub-array is constructed and associated with it. The reference counter, if any, is incremented. So, when you modify the matrix formed using such a constructor, you also modify the corresponding elements of m . If you want to have an independent copy of the sub-array, use Mat.Clone() .
Array of selected ranges of m along each dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.MatOfPoint3d.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: constructor for matrix headers pointing to user-allocated data
member.param: Number of rows in a 2D array.
Number of columns in a 2D array.

Pointer to the user data. Matrix constructors that take data and step parameters do not allocate matrix data. Instead, they just initialize the matrix header that points to the specified data, which means that no data is copied. This operation is very efficient and can be used to process external data using OpenCV functions. The external data is not automatically deallocated, so you should take care of it.

Number of bytes each matrix row occupies. The value should include the padding bytes at the end of each row, if any. If the parameter is missing (set to AUTO_STEP ), no padding is assumed and the actual step is calculated as cols*elemSize() .

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ORB
member.summary: Class implementing the ORB (*oriented BRIEF*) keypoint detector and descriptor extractor
member.remarks: described in @cite RRKB11 . The algorithm uses FAST in pyramids to detect stable keypoints, selects the strongest features using FAST or Harris response, finds their orientation using first-order moments and computes the descriptors using BRIEF (where the coordinates of random point pairs (or k-tuples) are rotated according to the measured orientation).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoWriter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Double,OpenCvSharp.Size,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates video writer structure.
member.param: Name of the output video file.

4-character code of codec used to compress the frames. For example, "PIM1" is MPEG-1 codec, "MJPG" is motion-jpeg codec etc. Under Win32 it is possible to pass null in order to choose compression method and additional compression parameters from dialog.
Framerate of the created video stream.
Size of video frames.
If it is true, the encoder will expect and encode color frames, otherwise it will work with grayscale frames (the flag is currently supported on Windows only).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Grab
member.summary: Grabs the frame from camera or file. The grabbed frame is stored internally. The purpose of this function is to grab frame fast that is important for syncronization in case of reading from several cameras simultaneously. The grabbed frames are not exposed because they may be stored in compressed format (as defined by camera/driver). To retrieve the grabbed frame, cvRetrieveFrame should be used.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Retrieve(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the image grabbed with cvGrabFrame function.
member.param: non-zero streamIdx is only valid for multi-head camera live streams

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Retrieve(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.CameraChannels)
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the image grabbed with cvGrabFrame function. The returned image should not be released or modified by user.
member.param: non-zero streamIdx is only valid for multi-head camera live streams

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Read(OpenCvSharp.Mat)
member.summary: Grabs a frame from camera or video file, decompresses and returns it. This function is just a combination of cvGrabFrame and cvRetrieveFrame in one call. The returned image should not be released or modified by user.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SIFT
member.summary: SIFT implementation.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SIFT.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates instance by raw pointer cv::SURF*

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SIFT.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The SIFT constructor.
member.param: The number of best features to retain. The features are ranked by their scores (measured in SIFT algorithm as the local contrast)
The number of layers in each octave. 3 is the value used in D. Lowe paper. The number of octaves is computed automatically from the image resolution.
The contrast threshold used to filter out weak features in semi-uniform (low-contrast) regions. The larger the threshold, the less features are produced by the detector.

The threshold used to filter out edge-like features. Note that the its meaning is different from the contrastThreshold, i.e. the larger the edgeThreshold, the less features are filtered out (more features are retained).
The sigma of the Gaussian applied to the input image at the octave #0. If your image is captured with a weak camera with soft lenses, you might want to reduce the number.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Window.DisplayOverlay(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Display text on the window's image as an overlay for delay milliseconds. This is not editing the image's data. The text is display on the top of the image.
member.param: Overlay text to write on the window’s image
Delay to display the overlay text. If this function is called before the previous overlay text time out, the timer is restarted and the text updated. . If this value is zero, the text never disapers.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Window.DisplayStatusBar(System.String,System.Int32)
member.param: Text to write on the window’s statusbar
Delay to display the text. If this function is called before the previous text time out, the timer is restarted and the text updated. If this value is zero, the text never disapers.

member.summary: Creates the HOG descriptor and detector.
member.param: Detection window size. Align to block size and block stride.
Block size in pixels. Align to cell size. Only (16,16) is supported for now.
Block stride. It must be a multiple of cell size.
Cell size. Only (8, 8) is supported for now.
Number of bins. Only 9 bins per cell are supported for now.
Gaussian smoothing window parameter.
L2-Hys normalization method shrinkage.
Flag to specify whether the gamma correction preprocessing is required or not.
Maximum number of detection window increases.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.HOGDescriptor.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.summary: Returns coefficients of the classifier trained for people detection (for default window size).
